Description: Vase of green feldspar: with a rounded, flattened body and a narrow neck. The rim was originally covered with gold, a band of unpolished stone showing the original position of the metal. Interior only partially hollowed, showing clear drill-marks.
Curator's comments: Compare the form from tomb B. 15 at Abydos, in W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. XLIX,133. Nicholson and Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000), p. 46
